main event: A bright, stationary light was sighted over Washington, D.C. on February 6, 1959.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 15 minutes.
The object was described as a small, bright light, about the size of a star, at an estimated altitude of 10,000 to 15,000 feet.
No sound was associated with the object.
Numerous attempts were made to visually track the object using binoculars and telescopes, but it remained stationary and did not appear to move.
No further information is available at the time of the report.
photographs: no, the report does not mention any photographs
